group.label: Hreflang URLs Settings:
group.comment: The hreflang tag helps the Web crawler understand which version of the website should be shown for a certain location. The hreflang settings can be managed depending on the store view. To change the store view use the dropdown on the upper left side of the configuration page.

field.label: Hreflang URLs Scope
field.comment: Specify the Alternate URLs Scope. If set to Website, the Hreflang URLs work within one website only. If set to Global, the Hreflang URLs work between websites.

field.label: Multi-stores CMS pages relation
field.comment: Specifies how to identify the same CMS page for different store views. Use By ID if you create one page for different stores, therefore, their ID will be the same. Use By URL Key if you created separate pages for different stores and assign them the same URL. Use By Hreflang Key for the pages that are linked manually.

field.label: Hreflang Settings
Overview of Alternate Hreflang Settings
field.comment: To observe the changes, click the Save Config button.

group.label: Canonical URLs Settings:
group.comment: You need to disable the standard Magento canonical first.

field.label: Add Canonical URL Meta Header
field.comment: The default setting to add the canonical tag.

field.label: Disable Canonical URL for Pages with NOINDEX robots
field.comment: Disables the canonical URL if the page has the NOINDEX meta robots tag. Useful as the NOINDEX pages won't be shown in the search results.

field.label: Canonical URL won't be added for these pages
field.comment:
Hides the canonical URL on the pages added in this setting.
Action names allowed: use catalog_category_view for all categories, catalog_product_view for all products.

field.label: Cross Domain Canonical
field.comment: Define the main storeview for the canonical URL. Useful for websites with several storeviews having the same or quite similar content. Use Custom URL to add any other website.

field.label: Cross Domain Canonical - Custom URL
Product Canonical URL Type
field.comment: The options depend on the "Use Categories Path for Product URLs" setting.

field.label: Canonical Tag For Associated Product
field.comment: The associated products of the chosen product types will have the canonical tag pointed to the parent (main) product.

field.label: Trailing Slash For Home Page Canonical URL
field.comment: The homepage can be indexed as both https://www.site.com and https://www.site.com/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm

field.label: Trailing Slash For Canonical URLs
field.comment: The web pages can be indexed as both https://www.site.com/page and https://www.site.com/page/. The canonical can either have this trailing slash (add) or not (crop). The trailing slash can be added to the pages without suffix .html or .htm

field.label: Use Pager For Category Canonical URL
field.comment: Add or remove the pager (?p=2 etc.) parameter from the canonical tag on the category pages.

field.label: Canonical Tag for Category Layered Navigation
field.comment: To see the differences among the options, click here. To overwrite this setting for each product attribute individually, go to Attributes Grid>Attribute>Storefront Properties and change the 'Canonical Tag for Pages Filtered by Layered Navigation Leads to' setting.

field.label: Canonical Tag if any LN Filter Use Multiple Selection
field.comment: Manages the canonical for any link that has the one-time selection of the several filters options within the same filter (multi-select). This setting works with MageWorx LayeredNavigation extension

group.label: Meta Robots Settings:
group.comment: The express default settings for meta robots. Additionally, the store owner can tweak meta robots tags for each category, product and CMS page individually.

field.label:
NOINDEX, FOLLOW Robots Meta Header
for Pages Without Content
field.comment:
Hide these pages without the valuable content from indexation.
Note: the links on these pages will still be indexed.

field.label:
NOINDEX, FOLLOW Robots Meta Header
for Additional Pages
field.comment:
Hide any page from indexation.
Note: the links on these pages will still be indexed. Wildcard allowed, examples:
sitemap_*
sitemap/*
Action names allowed: use catalog_category_view for all categories, catalog_product_view for all products, etc

field.label:
NOINDEX, NOFOLLOW Robots Meta Header
for Additional Pages
field.comment:
Hide any page from indexation.
Note: the links on these pages will still be indexed. Wildcard allowed, examples:
sitemap_*
sitemap/*
Action names allowed: use catalog_category_view for all categories, catalog_product_view for all products, etc

field.label: Default Meta Robots For Category LN Pages
field.comment: Provide the specific meta robots settings to Layered Navigation pages.

field.label: Count of filters for set NOINDEX, FOLLOW for LN
field.comment: Specify the indexation deepness for the applied filters combination. E.g., if you put 2 here, any filters combination with 2 or more filters selected will have the NOINDEX, FOLLOW tag and be excluded from the search results.

field.label: Robots for Attributes Combinations
Set NOINDEX, FOLLOW for LN Filters with Multiple Selection
field.comment: If enabled, the one-time selection of the several filters options within the same filter (multi-select) hides the URL from indexation. This setting is compatible with MageWorx LayeredNavigation extension

field.label: Add Link Rel="next/prev" on the Category Page
field.comment: This tag points the Web crawler, where exactly the first and the last category pages are, and what page is a next or a previous one.
